name: Sexton May
reviews: Royal enfield classic 350 legendary bike- the royal enfield classic 350 is a legendary bike.The latest model of the bike is very good looking with some minor changes from the previous one.There are a lot of things which i like about it.The engine refinement has improved a lot in this new model which was much necessary.Revised ergonomics make it more comfortable for both rider and pillion.New chass is makes it easier to ride in traffic.

name: Ballard James
reviews: My most favourite bike- the new royal enfield classic 350 made a fine attempt at dissuading me from riding anything else, And it succeeded to a fair extent, Too.Classic 300 is the important bike of the company.Previously these bikes had vibrations because of old engine.Now royal enfield has done great job by swapping a new non vibrating engine.Which attracts people to purchase the bike.It looks ve ry aggressive and stylish.

name: Robbins Romero
reviews: Royal enfield classic 350 with some cons- the royal enfield classic 350 is overall a good bike with some cons which can be observed after riding it for some time.As compared with the prices it doesn’t have the top-end performance of the meteor 350.New footpegs foul with your legs in traffic and while parking which is annoying and the thump of the old engine is missing.

name: Kelley Carey
reviews: Best in class if we compare it to other 650 cc segment, pocket friendly Classic retro look and performance and pickup is like time traveling. Vroom it's been 1 year I am riding this machine. I took it for touring as well Almost covered 9k km on this. Words are not enough to explain. No other Indian made bike can cross you and it’s a beast with no experience.

name: Maldonado Delacruz
reviews: This bike provides a very comfort riding on the long route journeys. The engine although gets heated after sometime, but it doesn't affect much to the rider. Before a trip a service is advised although, to ensure a safe and secure journey. Service is not usually required much. The riding comfort on trips will make you feel awesome.

name: Norton Serrano
reviews: Good powerful bike with great macho look. Replica of triumph street twin, but smooth and nimble. Gear changes is frequent as you can travel 40km/h in 3rd gear Cons- mileage 20km in city, heavy 210 kg with fuel. Stock ceat tyre's are tube type ( not tubeless like earlier firelli) so alloy wheel upgrade is more expensive.

name: Fuller Bruce
reviews: have owned the bike for around a year now and hence am in a fairly good position to review the bike. The ownership experience has been satisfactory. This boils down to the largely trouble free nature of the machine. It is well engineered and well put together. The reliability has been stellar and have not faced any glitches except for a fogging instrument console. I raised it with HSR Services (authorized dealer for RE) and their team got it replaced in a day.

name: Kellie Kennedy
reviews: Firstly it's Royal Enfield's first ever made cafe racer bike. I loved it by the looks and awesome styling, as there is more options for this cafe racer bikes, they don't have such great road presence, but well created. They are over priced according to Indian roads and rules. Only one thing i missed from interceptor 650 is led head lights and tail light.

name: Doyle Duncan
reviews: 0 to 100 in 5 seconds. No vibration, and excellent for long-distance with good control off-road and as well as on the road. 650 cc gives good speed on highways. I will recommend this who want to go for long drives with comfortable seating and uninterrupted ride with a good service network of Royal enfield.. Trusted brand.

name: Odonnell English
reviews: i bought this bike in sreehitha bike zone ashok nagar chennai look wise this bike is good and performance i don't know because bike clutch cable not fitted properly and screws nuts bolts fittings not in correct position so beware of this and think twice before buying this one.

name: Roy Knapp
reviews: Royal Enfield has done good job in shaping the bike and servicing. it will provide an uncommon riding experience. this is my first ever Motorcycle. I use it for daily commute, tours, traveling and weekend rides. I'm 163cm 65kg and little freak about speed. I ride the bike flawlessly it will always amaze me. All you need is better Practice and good Skills.3. Cool retro looks. Smooth engine and very good pickup.it will not hardly push till 170-180kmph, but it can keep you stay in 140-160kmph without any stress. Best sounding with Parellal twin.
